Description: The index of the fixation in temporal order.
The domain of the stimulus text.
Each participant reads all 12 texts, the order of which follows their trial number. If text b0 has trial number 2 for participant 5, this participant read text b0 as the second text.
The accuracy of background question 1. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The accuracy of background question 2. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The accuracy of background question 3. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The accuracy of text question 1. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The accuracy of text question 2. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The accuracy of text question 3. The answer can be either true or false, so the value is either 0 or 1.
The duration of the fixation in milliseconds.
The duration in milliseconds of the saccade that follows a fixation.
The duration of a saccade in milliseconds that preceeds a fixation.

Specifies the version of the items. In each version, the order of the stimuli and the order of the answer options for each question differs. The specifics of each version can be found in the items.tsv.
The texts were presented on the screen in multiple lines. Specifies the line of the respective row; indexing starts at 1.
The region of interest specified as character index in the text (see char_index_in_text). Defines which character has been fixated.
Index of a character in the line. Indexing starts at 1.
The index of the uncorrected fixation.
Whether or not the fixation has been adjusted manually.
The unique identifier given to each reader. Reader IDs start at 0.
Unique identifier given to each stimulus text.
The index of the word in the text. Indexing starts at 1.
The index of a sentence in the respective text. Indexing starts at 1.
Index of a character in the text. Indexing starts at 1.
Words as they appear in the stimuli texts. Words are split at white-space.
Character as text.
